name: ClusterMap
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Instance
ClusterMap
description: Instance::ClusterMap is a Hash with cluster name and gRPC object. It is used to create instance.

examples.caption: Create
examples.code:
clusters = Google::Cloud::Bigtable::Instance::ClusterMap.new

clusters.add("cluster-1", 3, location: "us-east1-b", storage_type: :SSD)

# Or
cluster.add("cluster-2", 1)

params.name: location
params.description:
The location where this clusterâ€™s nodes and storage reside. For best
performance, clients should be located as close as possible to this
cluster. Currently only zones are supported.

params.name: storage_type
params.description:
Valid values are:

  • :SSD(Flash (SSD) storage should be used), *:HDD(Magnetic drive (HDD) storage should be used)

If not set then default will set to :STORAGE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
